entries.meaning: (Australia, New Zealand) A session of sunbathing.
examples: It was a simple affair. We were camping down the south coast and one of my friends leapt out of the surf and slammed down onto the beach to have a sunbake – marvellous. We made the image and it's been around, I suppose as a sort of icon of the Australian way of life.

verbs.description: sunbake (third-person singular simple present sunbakes, present participle sunbaking, simple past and past participle sunbaked)

examples: Oh, she wants to moan with pain, thinking of Richard lying down on the sunbaking rock, naked as well.

Ancient precedents were important in establishing the long, lost history of the benefits of sunbaking. Journalists noted that ‘The ancients′ had recognised the importance of sunlight as a cure for disease; now modern New Zealanders had to do the same.
